isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CLUTCH CONTROL LINKAGE - 5000, 9300 AND 9400 SERIES - ADJUSTMENT - RELEASE SHAFT YOKE TO RELEASE BEARING CLEARANCE

svcproc.title: RELEASE SHAFT YOKE TO RELEASE BEARING CLEARANCE
svcproc.para: To obtain the specified release shaft yoke to release bearing housing clearance ( Figure 3), adjust the control linkage as outlined below. This adjustment will provide the specified clutch pedal free travel.

step1.para: Loosen the control rod adjusting yoke lock nut.
Remove the cotter and yoke pins and disconnect the control rod from release shaft or the pedal shaft lever.

figure.caption: Figure 3. Release Shaft Yoke to Release Bearing Clearance

step1.para: Rotate the release shaft until the release shaft yoke (fork) lightly contacts the release bearing housing.
Holding the release yoke (fork) against the release bearing housing (per Step 3), adjust the control rod yoke until the yoke pin can be freely installed through the yoke and shaft lever.
To obtain the specified clearance, lengthen the control rod by turning the yoke seven (7) turns counterclockwise (as viewed from the adjusting yoke end of the control rod).
Connect the control rod yoke to the shaft lever and install the yoke pin.

Where possible, inspect for the specified clearance between the release shaft yoke and the release bearing housing with the clutch pedal against its return stop. If necessary, readjust the linkage to obtain the specified clearance.
Tighten the control rod yoke lock nut and install a new cotter pin.
